intro: Diplotaxis crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved synedrella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters, attracting various pollinators. Diplotaxis crassifolia is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
